pid_data.process_description: This P&ID represents the complete operational workflow for preparing, transferring, conditioning, and delivering high-concentration hydrogen peroxide (H₂O₂) for thrust testing. The process begins at the starting point zone—the 1000-liter SUS-316 main storage tank, which is first cleaned using deionized and de-oxygenated water supplied from the 1000-L H₂O tank. It ends at the catalyst bed, the final delivery point where conditioned H₂O₂ is supplied for reaction testing. The overall operation is carried out in four phases: (Phase-1) cleaning and preparation of the main tank using DI/DO water introduced through valve V-O and drained through V-D; (Phase-2) transferring H₂O₂ from 20-liter supply barrels into the 1000-L tank via valves V-V, V-I, and the vacuum system connected through V-R; (Phase-3) distributing H₂O₂ from the main tank into three 145-liter carbon-fiber storage tanks via valve V-05 while nitrogen pressurization (60–80 barA) maintains transfer flow; and (Phase-4) delivering pressurized peroxide high-concentration H₂O from the three 145-L tanks to the catalyst bed using high-pressure nitrogen propulsion propels the peroxide through the transfer lines, Differential pressure transmitters (P6 and P7) monitor and control the flow rate, while thermometer T1 and a CO₂-based cooling system regulate temperature to protect the catalyst from overheating. Once conditioned, the peroxide enters the catalyst bed, marking the completion of the test operation.
system_inputs: DI/DO water from 1000 L H2O tank
Nitrogen supply bundle 1 (pressurization for 145 L tanks)
Nitrogen supply bundle 2 (pressurization for delivery line)
Cooling water / CO2-based cooling to chiller (implied)
system_outputs: Vent gas from 1000 L H2O2 tank
Vent gas from 145 L H2O2 tanks
Conditioned H2O2 to catalyst bed / chamber

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O2 Tank
equipment.context: Main peroxide storage and preparation tank; mounted on load cell

equipment.name: 1000 L H2O Tank
equipment.context: Deionized/de-oxygenated water supply for cleaning main tank; includes pump

equipment.name: 20 L H2O2 Barrel
equipment.context: Feed source drums weighed on scale before transfer

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 1
equipment.context: First high-pressure storage tank; on load cell

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 2
equipment.context: Second high-pressure storage tank; on load cell

equipment.name: 145 L H2O2 Tank 3
equipment.context: Third high-pressure storage tank; on load cell

equipment.name: N2 Bundle 1 (200 bar)
equipment.context: Nitrogen bundle feeding PR-1 to pressurize 145 L tanks

equipment.name: N2 Bundle 2 (200 bar)
equipment.context: Nitrogen bundle feeding PR-2 and PR-3 for line and catalyst bed pressurization

equipment.name: Vacuum pump
equipment.context: Provides suction for transferring H2O2 from barrels to 1000 L tank via vacuum line

equipment.name: Water transfer pump
equipment.context: Mounted on 1000 L H2O tank discharge to send cleaning water to 1000 L H2O2 tank

equipment.name: Chiller / cooler
equipment.context: CO2-based cooling system in delivery line upstream of catalyst bed

equipment.name: Catalyst bed
equipment.context: Final reaction bed receiving conditioned H2O2

equipment.name: Chamber
equipment.context: Receives reaction products downstream of catalyst bed

equipment.name: Weight scale for 20 L barrel
equipment.context: Measures mass of 20 L H2O2 barrels before/after transfer

equipment.name: Load cell 1000 L tank
equipment.context: Measures weight of 1000 L H2O2 tank

connections.context: (Phase-1) DI/DO water transfer from 1000 L H2O tank through pump E-PMP1 into 1000 L H2O2 tank for cleaning
(Phase-1) Drain from 1000 L H2O2 tank bottom to waste liquid system
(Phase-2) H2O2 transfer from 20 L barrels to 1000 L H2O2 tank assisted by vacuum; LC-1000 monitors fill mass
(Phase-2) Vacuum line from E-VACP to 1000 L H2O2 tank top to draw peroxide from barrels

connections.from_id: Vent gas from 1000 L H2O2 tank
connections.context: Venting line from 1000 L H2O2 tank through pressure regulator to atmosphere; P0 and T0 monitor tank conditions
(Phase-3) H2O2 distribution from 1000 L tank to 145 L tank 1; load cell LC-145-1 tracks mass
(Phase-3) H2O2 distribution from 1000 L tank to 145 L tank 2
(Phase-3) H2O2 distribution from 1000 L tank to 145 L tank 3
(Phase-3) N2 from bundle 1 via PR-1 to pressurize 145 L tank 1; P1 and P3 monitor pressure
(Phase-3) N2 from bundle 1 via PR-1 to pressurize 145 L tank 2; P2 monitors pressure
(Phase-3) N2 from bundle 1 via PR-1 to pressurize 145 L tank 3; P4 monitors pressure
(Phase-3) Top gas header interconnection between 145 L tanks 1 and 2; P5 measures common header pressure
(Phase-3) Continuation of gas header from 145 L tank 2 to tank 3
(Phase-4) Liquid H2O2 discharge from 145 L tank manifold into main delivery line upstream of chiller; P6/flow meter measure flow
(Phase-4) Conditioned peroxide from chiller to catalyst bed inlet region; P7, P8, P9, and T1 monitor pressure and temperature
(Phase-4) Hot gas/products from catalyst bed to thrust test chamber; T2 and P10 monitor outlet conditions
Waste liquid line from 145 L tank manifold to waste liquid handling
(Phase-4) Branch from main delivery line to waste liquid drain for line emptying or abort
(Phase-4) Venting/purging of delivery line to full pipe exhaust using N2 via PR-4
Nitrogen from bundle 2 via PR-2 to top header near 145 L tanks for additional pressurization or venting
Nitrogen from bundle 2 via PR-3 to catalyst bed region for pressurization and purging
Aggregate waste liquid from drains and vents to external waste treatment
General vent discharge from regulators and safety valves to atmosphere
